competitors.name: AMD (Advanced Micro Devices)
competitors.notes: Leading semiconductor competitor; filed unfair competition claims in 2004-2005

competitors.name: Motorola/PowerPC (AIM Alliance)
competitors.notes: PowerPC architecture competitor; Apple transitioned from PowerPC to Intel x86 in 2005

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Part of AIM alliance developing PowerPC architecture

competitors.name: Nvidia
competitors.notes: Led GPU market in late 1990s and 2005; competed in graphics processor space

competitors.name: ATI
competitors.notes: Led GPU market alongside Nvidia in 2005; later acquired by AMD in 2006

context: In 2005, Intel reorganized under CEO Paul Otellini. On June 6, 2005, Apple announced transition from PowerPC to Intel x86 processors, beginning a 15-year partnership.
